intro: Myosotis versicolor var. minor, commonly known as the lesser forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its stems are erect and branching. The flowers bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
